intro: Androsace bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, usually white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to survive in harsh, rocky environments. Androsace bidentata is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
